alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Lyon; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 17 at 4:18PM CDT until September 17 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Osage County in east central Kansas... Northwestern Coffey County in east central Kansas... Northeastern Lyon County in east central Kansas... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 417 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Reading, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lebo, Hartford, Neosho Rapids and Reading. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 138 and 149. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 142 and 144. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
